EventType.Name: BaseEvent
EventType.Description: This is the event that all other events are derrived from. This event will never be sent directly.
EventType.Parameter: Time is an integer specifying the number of milliseconds since the start of the simulation.

EventType.Name: FailedToCreateChatRoom
EventType.Description: OBSOLETE: Sent by TextChatServer to report result of RequestChatRoomCreate event.
EventType.Parameter: The reason the room couldn't be created.
The id of the decision maker that created the chat room.

EventType.Name: JoinChatRoom
EventType.Description: OBSOLETE: Sent by the GUI client to the controller to request that a decision maker be added to a chat room.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.
The decision maker that that is trying to join the chat room.

EventType.Name: TimeTick
EventType.Description: This event is sent by the ScenCon to the simulators to tell them to update to the next simulation time.
EventType.Parameter: The string representation of the current simulation time in HH:mm:ss format.

EventType.Name: SimulationTimeEvent
EventType.Parameter: The string representation of the current simulation time in HH:mm:ss format.

EventType.Name: ResetSimulation
EventType.Description: Deprecated

EventType.Name: SimCoreReady
EventType.Description: This event is sent from the SimCore to the ScenCon to let it know that the SimCore is done initializing.

EventType.Name: StartupComplete
EventType.Description: Sent by the ScenCon to announce that it is done sending out simulation initialization events. All the NewObject events should have already gone out now.

EventType.Name: RandomSeed
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to SimCore to initialize random number generator. The same random seed is used in a replay as in the original run so that attack results come out the same.
EventType.Parameter: The random seed that the SimCore will use for initializing its random number generator.

EventType.Name: NewObject
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to announce an object that will be in the simulation. The object is not on the screen yet. It must be revealed before it can interact with other objects.
EventType.Parameter: The unique ID of the object being created.
A string specifying the object type of the new object. This object type must be one of the types described in the Object Model.
The table of states for the new object.
The initial values of all the attributes (specified in the object model) of the new object. The StateTable and ID attributes are excluded.

EventType.Name: RevealObject
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to announce that the object is fully in the simulation world and can start interacting with other objects.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object that will appear in the simulation.
The initial values of all the attributes (specified in the object model) of the revealed object. The StateTable and ID attributes are excluded.

EventType.Name: SubplatformLaunch
EventType.Description: The ScenCon sends this event to initiate the SimCore object launch process.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object that will appear in the simulation.
The unique id of the parent of the object being launched.
The location to which the object will be launched.

EventType.Name: History_SubplatformLaunch
EventType.Description: A data logging event.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object that will appear in the simulation.
The unigue id of the parent object
The location of the parent. (The child is launched to this location also.)
The destination location of the launched object.
Was this a launch a weapon launch or a normal subplatform launch.
If this was a weapon launch, this is the target that the weapon was launched at.

EventType.Name: History_Pursue
EventType.Description: A data logging event.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object that will appear in the simulation.
The location of the pursuing object
The unigue id of the target object
The location of the target object.

EventType.Name: WeaponLaunch
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to SimCore to accounce the firing of a weapon. A specialized version of SubplatformLaunch.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object that will appear in the simulation.
The unique id of the parent object.
The unique id of the object the weapon was launched at.

EventType.Name: SubplatformDock
EventType.Description: Sent from ScenCon to SimCore to announce that a subplatform has rejoined its parent object.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the docking object.
The unique id of the object that is being docked to.

EventType.Name: ObjectCollision
EventType.Description: Sent by SimCore when two objects with non-zero size collide with each other. Deprecated.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the first colliding object.
The unique id of the second colliding object.

EventType.Name: MoveObject
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to SimCore to announce that an object has changed its course and has a new destination.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object.
The current X,Y,Z location in meters. X = UTM Easting Y = UTM Northing Z = altitude in meters
A floating point number between 0 and 1.

EventType.Name: TransferObject
EventType.Description: Sent to indicate that an asset has been transferred to a different DecisionMaker
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker receiving the asset.
The unique id of the asset being transferred.
The unique id of the decision makerlosing the asset.

EventType.Name: MoveDone
EventType.Description: Sent by SimCore to tell the ScenCon that an object has reached its destination.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object.
Why the move is done.

EventType.Name: ClientAttackRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a GUI client or agent request that an object attack another object.
EventType.Parameter: The decision maker that is making the attack request.
The unique id of the attacking object.
The unique id of the object that is being attacked.
The name of the weopon or capability that is to be used in the attack.

EventType.Name: AttackObject
EventType.Description: Sent by the ScenCon to announce that an object has started attacking another object.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the attacking object.
The unique id of the object being attacked.
The name of the capability used in the attack.

EventType.Name: AttackSucceeded
EventType.Description: Sent by the AttackSim after an attack is completed.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the attacking object.
The unique id of the object being attacked.
The new state of the attacked object.
The name of the capability used in the attack.

EventType.Name: History_AttackedObjectReport
EventType.Description: A data logging event.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object being attacked.
The location of the object being attacked.
Was the attack successful?
The name of the state the object was transitioned to.

EventType.Name: History_AttackerObjectReport
EventType.Description: A data logging event.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the attacking object.
The location of the attacking object.
The unique id of the object being attacked.
The location of the target object.
The capability being applied to the target.

EventType.Name: SelfDefenseAttackStarted
EventType.Description: Sent by the SimCore to announce that a self-defense attack has started.
EventType.Parameter: The Unique ID of the object acting in self-defense.
The Unique Id of the object being attacked via self-defense.

EventType.Name: StateChange
EventType.Description: Sent by the SimCore to announce that an object has gone through a state-change.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the object.
The name of the new state for the object.

EventType.Name: ViewProAttributeUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by the ViewPro to the GUI client or agent to announce that an object's sensed attribute has changed.
EventType.Parameter: The player who is intended to receive this event.
The ObjectID of the object being updated.
The OwnerID of the object being updated.
The attributes known about the object.

EventType.Name: ViewProActiveRegionUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by the ViewPro to a client GUI or agent to alert it that an active region is present.
EventType.Parameter: The ObjectID of the object being updated.
Is the region visible on the client screen?
The color to show the region.
The vertices of the region.

EventType.Name: ActiveRegionSpeedMultiplierUpdate
EventType.Description: A SimCore internal event.
EventType.Parameter: The ObjectID of the object being updated.

EventType.Name: ViewProInitializeObject
EventType.Description: Sent by the ViewPro to a client GUI or agent to initialize an object. This will be sent for all objects even if they haven't been sensed.
EventType.Parameter: The decision maker that this event is being sent to.
The unique id of the object.
The initial location of the object.
The icon to use when displaying the object.
The decision maker that owns the object.
Is this object a weapon?
The color that the icon's label should be shown in.

EventType.Name: ViewProMotionUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by ViewPro to a client GUI or agent to update the motion of an object. This will be sent once for each object and isn't based on sensors.
EventType.Parameter: With ViewProInitializeObject, this event might just become a broadcast event.
The ObjectID of the object being updated.
The OwnerID of the object being updated.
The current location of the object.
The destination location of the object.
The maximum speed of the object.
The fraction of maximum speed that the object should move at. Between 0 and 1.
To ensure that the client GUI has an icon to display for an object.
If this is true, then this is a weapon, and should be displayed with a bounding box.

EventType.Name: ViewProAttackUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by ViewPro to alert a client GUI or agent that an attack has started.
EventType.Parameter: Attacking object's ID
Target object's ID
The time at which the attack will cease.

EventType.Name: ViewProStopObjectUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by ViewPro to alert a client GUI or agent that an object has stopped its motion.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the object being stopped.

EventType.Name: ClientMeasure_ScreenView
EventType.Description: This event is sent out from each connected DDD Client each time tick where the screen position, size, or zoom level has changed from the last tick.
EventType.Parameter: This parameter is the X value of the origin point of the user's current view. This value is in meters from origin (top left corner of screen).
This parameter is the Y value of the origin point of the user's current view. This value is in meters from origin (top left corner of screen).
This parameter is the Width value of the user's current view. This value is in meters.
This parameter is the Height value of the user's current view. This value is in meters.
This parameter is the zoom level of the user's current view. A value of 1 is 100%, of .25 is 25%, of 2 is 200%.
This parameter is the DM ID of the player whose screen this information is describing.

EventType.Name: ClientMeasure_ObjectSelected
EventType.Description: This event is sent out from each connected DDD Client each time that user selects (or de-selects) an object
EventType.Parameter: The object ID of the user's newly selected object. If this is an empty string, then they have no object selected.
The DM ID of the user who is selecting an object.
The DM ID of the user who owns the selected object.

EventType.Name: ClientMeasure_CapabilitySelected
EventType.Description: This event is sent out from each connected DDD Client each time a weapon or capability is selected.
EventType.Parameter: The DM ID of the user who is selecting the capability or weapon.
The object ID of the object that owns the capability or weapon (this is also the currently selected object).
The name of the capability or weapon being selected.

EventType.Name: ClientMeasure_ObjectTabSelected
EventType.Description: This event is sent out from each connected DDD Client each time a tab is selected in the user controls section.
EventType.Parameter: The currently selected object's ID.
The name of the tab that is currently selected.
This parameter is the DM ID of the player whose screen this information is describing.

EventType.Name: Playfield
EventType.Description: Sent by the ScenCon to client GUIs or agents to initialize map information.
EventType.Parameter: The file name for the map meta data file. This file contains: the image filename The icon library (optional) the meters per pixel the UTM Zone of the bottom left corner of the map the UTM Northing of the bottom left corner of the map the UTM Easting of the bottom left corner of the map
The name of the icon library to be used when finding icons for this scenario.
the UTM Zone of the bottom left corner of the map
the UTM Northing of the bottom left corner of the map
the UTM Easting of the bottom left corner of the map
The map's horizontal meters per pixel ratio
The map's vertical meters per pixel ratio
Name of the scenario.
Description of the Scenario.

EventType.Name: MoveObjectRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the ScenCon to request that an object be moved.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker requesting the action.
The unique id of the object.
The destination X,Y,Z location in meters. X = UTM Easting Y = UTM Northing Z = altitude in meters
a floating point number between 0 and 1.

EventType.Name: AttackObjectRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the ScenCon to request that an object attack another object.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker requesting the action.
The unique id of the attacking object.
The unique id of the object being attacked.
The name of the capability used in the attack.

EventType.Name: SubplatformLaunchRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the ScenCon to request that a docked object be launched from its parent object.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker requesting the action.
The unique id of the object being launched.
The unique id of the object that is launching a child
The destination that the object should be launched to.

EventType.Name: SubplatformDockRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the ScenCon to request that an object be docked to its parent object.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker requesting the action.
The unique id of the docking object.
The id of the object that the docking object is being docked to.

EventType.Name: WeaponLaunchRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the ScenCon to request that a weapon be fired from its parent object at a target.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker requesting the action.
The unique id of the attacking object. This is the weapon being launched.
The unique id of the attacking object. This is the object which is launching the weapon.
The unique id of the object being attacked.

EventType.Name: WeaponLaunchFailure
EventType.Description: This event is sent out from the Server when a Weapon Launch or Weapon Launch Request fails. It's main purpose is to alert the View Pro to re-allocate the weapon which was not launched. This failure can be due to permissions, lack of munitions, or if the target is no longer in the simulation.
EventType.Parameter: The launching platform ID.
The ID of the weapon that was to-be launched.
A text description for either the Client's benefit, or for the Server's benefit, why did this request fail.

EventType.Name: TextChatRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the TextChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the chat message.
The chat message to be sent.
outdated...
The name of the ChatRoom; (OBSOLETE) if ChatType == P2P, this is the unique ID of the decision maker receiving the message.

EventType.Name: WhiteboardLineRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the WhiteboardChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The type of line to be drawn.
The starting location of the line.
The end location of the line.
The width of the line.
The scale the map was set at when this shape was drawn.
The color of the line.
Text to include on line.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardLine
EventType.Description: Sent by the WhiteboardServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: An ID unique to this whiteboard room for this whiteboard object.
The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The type of line to be drawn.
The starting location of the line.
The end location of the line.
The width of the line.
The scale the map was set at when this shape was drawn.
The color of the line.
Text to include on line.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardClearRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the WhiteboardChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardClear
EventType.Description: Sent by the WhiteboardServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the chat message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardClearAllRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the WhiteboardChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardClearAll
EventType.Description: Sent by the WhiteboardServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the chat message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardUndoRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the WhiteboardChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: An ID unique to this whiteboard room for this whiteboard object.
The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardUndo
EventType.Description: Sent by the WhiteboardServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: An ID unique to this whiteboard room for this whiteboard object.
The unique id of the decision maker sending the chat message.
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardSyncScreenViewRequest
EventType.Description: Sent by a client GUI or agent to the WhiteboardChatServer.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The name of the user to sync your view with;
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: WhiteboardSyncScreenView
EventType.Description: Sent by the WhiteboardServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker sending the whiteboard message.
The name of the user to sync your view with;
The name of the WhiteboardRoom;

EventType.Name: TransferObjectRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to indicate that a client has requested that an asset transferred to a different DecisionMaker
EventType.Parameter: The unique id of the decision maker making the request.
The unique id of the asset being transferred.
The unique id of the new owner.
The current state of the object.

EventType.Name: TextChat
EventType.Description: Sent by the TextChatServer to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: The chat message to be sent.
The unique id of the decision maker sending the chat message. If a System message, == "SYSTEM".
ALL for a global message, a specific team name for a certain team, or an individual user's unique ID for only that user. Each client needs to know which to receive, and which to drop.

EventType.Name: SystemMessage
EventType.Description: Sent by the SimCore or Controller to report a message to a client GUI or agent.
EventType.Parameter: The decision maker the message is being sent to.
The content of the message.
The color that the message should be displayed as.
Use "DEFAULT" for whatever the client considers the default, "POP" to request a popup alert.

EventType.Name: AuthenticationRequest
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: The username the player is logging in with.
The hashed password.
The id of the machine that is logging in.

EventType.Name: AuthenticationResponse
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: True if authentication accepted.
Message displayed to user
The intended terminal ID.

EventType.Name: HandshakeGUIRegister
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the machine that is logging in.

EventType.Name: HandshakeAvailablePlayers
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the machine that this message is being sent to.
A list of decision maker ids that haven't been selected by a player yet.
outdated parameter.
A list of all the players in the scenario.

EventType.Name: HandshakeGUIRoleRequest
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: A decision maker id.
A machine id.
Can be FULL or OBSERVER.

EventType.Name: HandshakeInitializeGUI
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: A decision maker id.
A machine id.
PLACEHOLDER
The Scenario's name.
The Scenario's description.
The Map's file name. Right now, this should be Map.jpg
The map's northing value.
The map's easting value.
The map's Horizontal Pixels Per Meter value.
The map's Vertical Pixels Per Meter value.
Briefing for the specified player.
The image library dll for this scenario.
If this value is false, then the voice chat menu option will be disabled.
The server name of the conaito voice server.
The port number of the conaito voice server.
The password for clients to log into the conaito voice server.

EventType.Name: HandshakeInitializeGUIDone
EventType.Description: Part of the client GUI initialization handshake.
EventType.Parameter: A decision maker id.
Can be FULL or OBSERVER.

EventType.Name: ClientRemoveObject
EventType.Description: Sent by the ViewPro to a client GUI to announce that an object should be removed from the playfield and forgotten about.
EventType.Parameter: A decision maker id.
The id of the object.

EventType.Name: ExternalApp_Message
EventType.Description: Used by an external application or agent to communicate with another external application. Has no effect on the DDD simulation.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the external app. This should always be used so that two external apps don't interfere with each other.
Whatever data the apps want to exchange.

EventType.Name: ExternalApp_Log
EventType.Description: Used by an external application or agent to inject data into the DDD data log.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the external app. This should always be used so that two external apps don't interfere with each other.
The content of the log entry in whatever format the app wants to put it in.

EventType.Name: DisconnectDecisionMaker
EventType.Description: Sent by client GUI to Server to announce that it is disconnecting.
EventType.Parameter: The ID of the DM who is disconnecting from the system.

EventType.Name: DisconnectTerminal
EventType.Description: An internal server event to announce that a client GUI has lost a connection.
EventType.Parameter: The TerminalID of the DM to be removed.

EventType.Name: ExternalApp_SimStart
EventType.Description: Sent to alert external applications and agents that the simulation has started.

EventType.Name: ExternalApp_SimStop
EventType.Description: Sent to alert external applications and agents that the simulation has stopped.

EventType.Name: LoadScenarioRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to request that a scenario be loaded.
EventType.Parameter: The path to the scenario file on the server machine.
The group name used for tagging output files.
That directory that the output log will be saved to.

EventType.Name: StopScenarioRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to request that the scenario be stopped.

EventType.Name: PauseScenario
EventType.Description: Sent to announce that the simlation has been paused.

EventType.Name: ResumeScenario
EventType.Description: Sent to announce that the simulation is being restarted after a pause.

EventType.Name: PauseScenarioRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to the server from the agent API to request a scenario pause.

EventType.Name: ResumeScenarioRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to the server from the agent API to request a scenario resume.

EventType.Name: StopScenario
EventType.Description: Sent to announce that a simulation has been stopped.

EventType.Name: ServerState
EventType.Description: Sent by the server to report its current state.
EventType.Parameter: The the new state of the server
Any error messages or extra info

EventType.Name: StopReplay
EventType.Description: Sent to announce that a replay has been stopped.

EventType.Name: GameSpeedRequest
EventType.Description: Sent to request that the simulation's speed factor should be changed.
EventType.Parameter: If speed factor == 5, 1 sim second = 1/5 real seconds.

EventType.Name: GameSpeed
EventType.Description: Sent to announce that the simulation's speed factor has been changed.
EventType.Parameter: If speed factor == 5, 1 sim second = 1/5 real seconds.

EventType.Name: PlayerControl
EventType.Description: Sent to announce whether a decision maker is being played by a human or by the computer. If the decision maker is played by the computer, self-defense will be activated for objects under that decision maker's control.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the decision maker.
Either HUMAN or COMPUTER.

EventType.Name: RequestChatRoomCreate
EventType.Description: Sent by client GUI to Controller to request that a chat room be created.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.
The decision makers that are members of the room.
The id of the decision maker that created the chat room.

EventType.Name: CreateChatRoom
EventType.Description: Sent by Controller to Text Chat Server
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.
The decision makers that are members of the room.
The id of the decision maker that created the chat room.

EventType.Name: AddToChatRoom
EventType.Description: Sent by the controller to the chat server request that a decision maker be added to a chat room.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.
The decision maker that that is trying to join the chat room.

EventType.Name: RequestCloseChatRoom
EventType.Description: Sent by Client GUI to Controller to request that a Chat Room be closed
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.
The id of the decision maker that wants to close the chat room.

EventType.Name: CloseChatRoom
EventType.Description: Sent by the Controller to the TextChatServer to request that a chat room be closed.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the chat room.

EventType.Name: RequestWhiteboardRoomCreate
EventType.Description: Sent by client GUI to Controller to request that a whiteboard room be created.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the whiteboard room.
The decision makers that are members of the room.
The id of the decision maker that created the whiteboard room.

EventType.Name: CreateWhiteboardRoom
EventType.Description: Sent by Whiteboard Server to the clients
EventType.Parameter: The name of the whiteboard room.
The decision makers that are members of the room.
The id of the decision maker that created the whiteboard room.

EventType.Name: CreateVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Sent by Controller to Voice Server
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel
The decision makers that are members of the room.

EventType.Name: JoinVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Event sent from VoiceServer when a client requests to begin listening/speaking on a specific voice channel
EventType.Parameter: Name of the channel the DM is now participating in
ID of the DM that is now participating in the channel

EventType.Name: RequestJoinVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Event sent from VoiceClient to VoiceServer when a client requests to begin listening/speaking on a specific voice channel
EventType.Parameter: Name of the channel the DM wants to participate in
ID of the DM that is now participating in the channel

EventType.Name: LeaveVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Event sent from VoiceServer when a client requests to stop listening/speaking on a specific voice channel
EventType.Parameter: Name of the channel the DM has stopped participating in
ID of the DM that is no longer participating in the channel

EventType.Name: RequestLeaveVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Event sent from VoiceClient to VoiceServer when a client requests to stop listening/speaking on a specific voice channel
EventType.Parameter: Name of the channel the DM has stopped participating in
ID of the DM that is no longer participating in the channel

EventType.Name: AddToVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Sent by the controller to the voice server request that a decision maker be added to a channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel
The decision maker that that is trying to join the chat room.

EventType.Name: RemoveFromVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Sent by the controller to the voice server request that a decision maker be added to a channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel
The decision maker that that is being removed from the chat room.

EventType.Name: CloseVoiceChannel
EventType.Description: Sent by the Controller to the Voice Server to request that a channel be closed.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: RequestStartedTalking
EventType.Description: Sent by the client GUI to the voice server to indicate that a particular DM wishes to speak on the channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: StartedTalking
EventType.Description: Sent by the voice server to the client GUI to indicate that a particular DM wishes to speak on the channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: PlayVoiceMessage
EventType.Description: Insert a voice message from a file
EventType.Parameter: Channel that will play the message
Location of the file containing the message

EventType.Name: PlayVoiceMessageToUser
EventType.Description: Insert a voice message from a file
EventType.Parameter: User that will hear the message
Location of the file containing the message

EventType.Name: RequestStoppedTalking
EventType.Description: Sent by the client GUI to the voice server to indicate that a particular DM wishes to stop speaking on the channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: StoppedTalking
EventType.Description: Sent by the voice server to the client GUI to indicate that a particular DM wishes has stopped talking
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: RequestMuteUser
EventType.Description: Sent by the client GUI to mute a user on a particular voice channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: MuteUser
EventType.Description: Sent by the voice server to the client GUI to mute a user on a particular channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: RequestUnmuteUser
EventType.Description: Sent by the client GUI to unmute a user on a particular voice channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: UnmuteUser
EventType.Description: Sent by the voice server to the client GUI to unmute a user on a particular channel
EventType.Parameter: The name of the channel

EventType.Name: ScoreUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by SimCore to report a score change.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the decision maker.
The name of the score.
The current value of the score.

EventType.Name: ExternalEmailReceived
EventType.Description: Sent by the DDDEmailBridge when an email is sent to the DDD. This exists for the purpose of logging.
EventType.Parameter: The email address of the sender.
The list of email addresses the message was sent to.
A DateTime string of when the email server received the email.
The subject of the email.
The body of the email.
A list of paths to the attachment files.

EventType.Name: ActiveRegionUpdate
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to update whether an ActiveRegion is active or visible.
EventType.Parameter: The id of the region.
Is the region visible to players.
Does the region modify object behavior.

EventType.Name: EngramValue
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to update an engram value.
EventType.Parameter: The name of the engram.
If present, the one unit to which this engram value change refers
A string representation of the engram value.
The name of the data type of the engram value.

EventType.Name: ClientSideAssetTransferAllowed
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to tell client if clients can transfer their assets
EventType.Parameter: True if assets can be transferred

EventType.Name: ClientSideRangeRingDisplayLevel
EventType.Description: Sent by ScenCon to inform the SimCore about how to formulate range ring info.
EventType.Parameter: Enum between Disabled, Private, SharedSensorNetwork, Full

EventType.Name: ChangeTagRequest
EventType.Description: Sent from client to ScenCon to request a change on a unit's tag
EventType.Parameter: The unit whose tag is to be changed
The decision maker requesting the tag change
The text for the teg

EventType.Name: UpdateTag
EventType.Parameter: The unit whose tag is being changed
The new tag value
All the players who will see the new tag

Simulator.Name: Motion
Simulator.Description: It modifies the location and velocity based on the maximum speed, throttle, and destination. As each time tick comes in, it updates the location.

Simulator.Name: FuelHandling
Simulator.Description: This maintains an object's fuel attributes and sends a "Dead" state change if the object runs out of fuel.

Simulator.Name: AttackProcessor
Simulator.Description: This simulator listens for attack events, determines the result of an attack, and sends out a state change if necessary.

Simulator.Name: StaticAttribute
Simulator.Description: The static attribute simulator owns all the attributes not owned by other simulators and is responsible for changing them when a state change occurs.

Simulator.Name: BlackboardManager
Simulator.Description: The blackboard manager listens for new object events. When it gets one, it adds a new object to the blackboard and owns its ID attribute.

Simulator.Name: ViewPro
Simulator.Description: The ViewPro watches all the attributes and sends ViewProUpdate events whenever an attribute changes.
